text: Run RStudio preinstalled ReLTER package Docker.

what: Install a different branch of ReLTER package
title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: Edit addReLTER.sh script modify last line, using name preferred branch ref= parameter value:

title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: Run locally port 8080 (change port like). can change ‚ÄúyourpasswordW password prefer. Open browser localhost:8080 login
code: docker run -d -e PASSWORD=yourpassword -p 8080:8787 rocker_relter user: rstudio password: youpassword

what: Preserve your work (use a docker volume)
title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: stop docker container, files created within lost. order preserve work across different runs, link local volume (example, current working directory, $(pwd)) container:

title: Run ReLTER in a Docker container
text: can also use precompiled image docker hub:
code: docker pull ptagliolato/rocker_relter docker run -d -e PASSWORD=yourpassword -p 8080:8787 ptagliolato/rocker_relter

what: Get affiliation info of the LTER site:
title: How to get the info of a (one) LTER Site by knowing the DEIMS ID
text: aim obtain info networks/RIs site listed, can: list network(s) site listed list project(s) site listed
code: siteAffiliations <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = 'https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe',   category = 'Affiliations' ) # network(s) where the site is involved in knitr::kable(   siteAffiliations$affiliation.networks[[1]]$network,   caption = "The list of the network(s) in which the site is listed" ) # project(s) where the site is involved in knitr::kable(   siteAffiliations$affiliation.projects[[1]],   caption = "The list of the project(s) in which the site is listed" )

what: Get boundaries info of the LTER site:
title: How to get the info of a (one) LTER Site by knowing the DEIMS ID
text: aim obtain info geographic extent covering area measurements, can:
code: siteBoundaries <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "Boundaries" )  tmap::tmap_mode("view") ## tmap mode set to interactive viewing tmap::tm_basemap("OpenStreetMap") +   tmap::tm_shape(siteBoundaries) +   tmap::tm_polygons(col = "skyblue", alpha = 0.25, border.col = "blue")

what: Get Contacts info of the LTER site:
title: How to get the info of a (one) LTER Site by knowing the DEIMS ID
text: aim obtain info reference contact person responsible site, organisation operating site monitoring programme(s), reference organisation responsible national authority funding strategic decisions site full name person(s) organisation(s) created documentation site, can: list manager(s) site list operating organization site list metadata provider(s) site list funding agency(ies) site approach used category information. selecting category Infrastructure can obtain info : access type data policy selecting category Infrastructure can obtain info : air temperature (min, max average) precipitation (min, max average) biogeographical region biome ecosystem type eunis habitat geoBon biome geology hydrology soil vegetation
code: siteContact <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "Contacts" ) # site manager(s) knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]],   caption = "The list of the manager(s) of site" ) # operating organisation of site knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.operatingOrganisation[[1]],   caption = "The list of the operating organization of the site" ) # metadata provider(s) of site knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.metadataProvider[[1]],   caption = "The list of the metadata provider(s) of site" ) # funding agency(ies) of site knitr::kable(   siteContact$generalInfo.fundingAgency[[1]],   caption = "The list of the funding agency(ies) of site" ) siteGeneral <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "General" ) siteGeneral ## # A tibble: 1 √ó 22 ##   title  uri   geoCoord country geoElev.avg geoElev.min geoElev.max geoElev.unit ##   <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <list>        <dbl>       <int>       <int> <chr>        ## 1 Lago ‚Ä¶ http‚Ä¶ POINT (‚Ä¶ <chr [‚Ä¶        194.         186        4633 msl          ## # ‚Ä¶ with 14 more variables: generalInfo.abstract <chr>, ## #   generalInfo.keywords <list>, generalInfo.status.label <chr>, ## #   generalInfo.status.uri <chr>, generalInfo.yearEstablished <int>, ## #   generalInfo.yearClosed <lgl>, generalInfo.hierarchy.parent <list>, ## #   generalInfo.hierarchy.children <lgl>, generalInfo.siteName <chr>, ## #   generalInfo.shortName <chr>, generalInfo.siteType <chr>, ## #   generalInfo.protectionLevel <lgl>, generalInfo.landUse <lgl>, ‚Ä¶ siteInfrastructure <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "Infrastructure" ) siteInfrastructure$generalInfo.collection ## [[1]] ##                collectionLabel collectionURI ## 1                  6 - 10 beds            NA ## 2                   > 5 places            NA ## 3                         Boat            NA ## 4                  Cable based            NA ## 5           Central station(s)            NA ## 6                        Paper            NA ## 7      Proprietary file format            NA ## 8          Relational database            NA ## 9  Sensor Web Enablement (SWE)            NA ## 10     Spatial data file (GIS)            NA ## 11              Telephone line            NA ## 12                XML database            NA siteEnvCharacts <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "EnvCharacts" ) siteEnvCharacts ## # A tibble: 1 √ó 26 ##   title  uri   geoCoord country geoElev.avg geoElev.min geoElev.max geoElev.unit ##   <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <list>        <dbl>       <int>       <int> <chr>        ## 1 Lago ‚Ä¶ http‚Ä¶ POINT (‚Ä¶ <chr [‚Ä¶        194.         186        4633 msl          ## # ‚Ä¶ with 18 more variables: envCharacteristics.airTemperature.avg <dbl>, ## #   envCharacteristics.airTemperature.min <dbl>, ## #   envCharacteristics.airTemperature.max <dbl>, ## #   envCharacteristics.airTemperature.unit <chr>, ## #   envCharacteristics.precipitation.annual <int>, ## #   envCharacteristics.precipitation.min <lgl>, ## #   envCharacteristics.precipitation.max <int>, ‚Ä¶

code: siteParameters <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "Parameters" ) # parameter(s) collected in the site knitr::kable(   siteParameters$parameter[[1]],   caption = "The list of the funding agency(ies) of site" ) siteRelateRes <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "RelateRes" ) # resource(s) related to the site (e.g. datasets, activities) knitr::kable(   siteRelateRes$relatedResources[[1]],   caption = "The list of the funding agency(ies) of site" ) siteResearchTop <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   category = "ResearchTop" ) # research topics(ies) of site knitr::kable(   siteResearchTop$researchTopics[[1]],   caption = "The list of the funding agency(ies) of site" )

title: How to get the list of contacts from list of DEIMS ID within csv file
text: obtain list contacts site List contacts
code: library(dplyr) site_results <- read.csv("./data/site_contacts_data.csv", sep = ";") %>%   dplyr::as_tibble() %>%    dplyr::mutate(url = paste0("https://deims.org/", DEIMS.ID))  contacts <- site_results$url %>%   purrr::map_dfr(.f = function(x) {     x %>% ReLTER::get_site_info(category = "Contacts") %>%       dplyr::select(title, uri, generalInfo.siteManager, geoCoord) %>%       tidyr::unnest()   }) %>%   dplyr::mutate(     site = paste0("[", title, "](", uri, ")"),     contact = paste0("[", name, "](mailto:", email, ")")   ) %>%   unique()  # Contacts table knitr::kable(   (contacts %>% dplyr::select(site, contact)),   caption = "List of the contacts",   booktabs = TRUE, longtable = TRUE )

library(dplyr) site_results_geo <- sf::st_as_sf( contacts, wkt = "geoCoord" ) listItaSitesMap <- leaflet::leaflet(site_results_geo) %>% leaflet::addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels", group = "Basemap", layerId = 123) %>% leaflet::addTiles("http://{s}.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_only_labels/{z}/{x}/{y}.png") %>% leaflet::addCircleMarkers( data = site_results_geo, radius = 3, weight = 2, opacity = 0.5, fill = TRUE, fillOpacity = 0.2, popup = paste0( 'eLTER site:
', site_results_geo$title, '

title: How to get the info of many than one LTER Sites

what: Get general information of the network‚Äôs sites:
title: How to get the info of many than one LTER Sites
text: Knowing network elTER id (DEIMS ID Network, e.g.¬†LTER-Italy https://deims.org/network/7fef6b73-e5cb-4cd2-b438-ed32eb1504b3), get_network_sites can download general info, name, DEIMS.iD coordinates sites belonging network selected. map sites can returned. list site LTER-Italy network
code: library(dplyr)  listItaSites <- ReLTER::get_network_sites(  networkDEIMSID =    "https://deims.org/network/7fef6b73-e5cb-4cd2-b438-ed32eb1504b3" ) knitr::kable(   listItaSites[1:10, ],   caption = "The list of site for LTER-Italy network" ) listItaSitesMap <- leaflet::leaflet(listItaSites) %>%   leaflet::addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels",                             group = "Basemap",                             layerId = 123) %>%   leaflet::addTiles("http://{s}.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_only_labels/{z}/{x}/{y}.png") %>%   leaflet::addCircleMarkers(     data = listItaSites,     radius = 3,     weight = 2,     opacity = 0.5,     fill = TRUE,     fillOpacity = 0.2   ) listItaSitesMap

title: How to get the info of many than one LTER Sites
text: Starting list LTER-Italy network‚Äôs sites (see first example ), using DEIMS ID list, get_site_info function (already described ). example proposed selection, list LTER-Italy sites, lakes environments map sites made. Using LTER-Italy sites list, next example provide contact list lake site managers. List contacts
code: library(dplyr) sites <- as_tibble(   listItaSites ) %>%   filter(grepl("Lago", title)) %>%   filter(!row_number() %in% c(1, 21, 22))  allSiteBound <- lapply(     as.list(       sites$uri     ),     ReLTER::get_site_info,     category = "Boundaries"   )  # Map sites_map <- leaflet::leaflet(allSiteBound) %>%   leaflet::addProviderTiles(provider = "CartoDB.PositronNoLabels",                             group = "Basemap",                             layerId = 123) %>%   leaflet::addTiles("http://{s}.basemaps.cartocdn.com/light_only_labels/{z}/{x}/{y}.png")  groups <- length(allSiteBound)  for (i in 1:groups) {   site_polygon <- allSiteBound[[i]]   sites_map <- sites_map %>%     leaflet::addPolygons(       data = site_polygon,       popup = ~ title,       group = i     ) } sites_map library(dplyr) sites <- as_tibble(   listItaSites ) %>%   filter(grepl("Lago", title)) %>%   filter(!row_number() %in% c(1, 21, 22))  allSiteContact <- lapply(     as.list(       sites$uri     ),     ReLTER::get_site_info,     category = "Contacts"   ) contacts <- tibble::tibble(   siteName = NA,   managerName = NA,   managerEmail = NA,   managerORCID = NA ) for (i in seq_len(length(allSiteContact))) {   contacts <- contacts %>%      tibble::add_row(       siteName = allSiteContact[[i]]$title,       managerName = allSiteContact[[i]]$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]]$name,       managerEmail = allSiteContact[[i]]$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]]$email,       managerORCID = allSiteContact[[i]]$generalInfo.siteManager[[1]]$orcid     ) } # Contacts table knitr::kable(   contacts,   caption = "List of the contacts" )

what: An Interface for the eLTER Community
title: An Interface for the eLTER Community
text: ReLTER R package provides access DEIMS-SDR, allowing interact software implemented eLTER Research Infrastructure (RI) improving data/information shared among Long Term Ecological Research (LTER) network. package conceived within eLTER H2020 project help advance development European Long-Term Ecosystem Research Infrastructures (eLTER RI). ReLTER package functions particular allows : retrieve information entities (e.g.¬†sites, datasets, activities) shared DEIMS-SDR (see e.g. get_site_info function); elaborate information single site merge info national network sites entire International LTER (ILTER) order provide maps, figures, graphs etc (see e.g. get_network_sites, produce_site_map produce_site_parameters_pie functions); interact ODSEurope managed members Geo-harmonizer project starting dataset shared DEIMS-SDR (see e.g. get_site_ODS function); improve quality dataset (see e.g. get_id_worms). Functions currently implemented derived discussion needs declared eLTER users community. ReLTER package follow progress eLTER-RI infrastructure evolve improvements development new tools.

title: An Interface for the eLTER Community
text: initial example, get_ilter_generalinfo function called find DEIMS ID specific eLTER site. function takes parameters ‚Äúcountry_name‚Äù ‚Äúsite_name‚Äù, returns site URL (DEIMS ID) DEIMS SDR infrastructure. countries, many sites similar names. method find DEIMS ID specific site interest.
code: # Obtain DEIMS ID for the Eisenwurzen site in Austria eisenwurzen <- ReLTER::get_ilter_generalinfo(country_name = "Austri",                                      site_name = "Eisen") # extract DEIMS ID (eisenwurzen_deimsid <- eisenwurzen$uri) #> [1] "https://deims.org/d0a8da18-0881-4ebe-bccf-bc4cb4e25701" # Obtain DEIMS ID for sites in Germany, with names like "TERENO" sites_germany <- ReLTER::get_ilter_generalinfo(country_name = "Germ",                                      site_name = "TERENO") # List full names of these sites sites_germany$title #>  [1] "TERENO Harz/Central German Lowland LTER - Germany"           #>  [2] "TERENO - Bad Lauchstaedt - Germany"                          #>  [3] "TERENO - Bode catchment - Germany"                           #>  [4] "TERENO - Friedeburg - Germany"                               #>  [5] "TERENO - Gimritz - Germany"                                  #>  [6] "TERENO - Greifenhagen - Germany"                             #>  [7] "TERENO - Schafstaedt - Germany"                              #>  [8] "TERENO - Siptenfelde - Germany"                              #>  [9] "TERENO - Wanzleben - Germany"                                #> [10] "TERENO - W√ºstebach - Germany"                                #> [11] "TERENO - Harsleben - Germany"                                #> [12] "TERENO Harz - central german lowland - Hohes Holz - Germany" #> [13] "TERENO - Rollesbroich - Germany"                             #> [14] "TERENO - Selhausen - Germany"                                #> [15] "TERENO Eifel Lower Rhine Valley - Germany" # Get the DEIMS ID of the site of interest by partial string match on the title idx <- which(stringr::str_detect(sites_germany$title,                                  "Friedeburg")) (friedeburg_deims_id <- sites_germany$uri[idx]) #> [1] "https://deims.org/a4dc71c4-de05-4883-ae53-7f57d51555fc"

title: An Interface for the eLTER Community
text: Next, get_site_info function, using category ‚ÄúBoundaries‚Äù, returns sf object. Furthermore, map overlayed boundaries site displayed, using site geographical boundaries provided DEIMS-SDR.
code: library(dplyr) siteBoundaries <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = 'https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe',   category = "Boundaries" )  tmap::tmap_mode("plot") r <- tmaptools::read_osm(siteBoundaries) tmap::tm_shape(r) +   tmap::tm_rgb() +   tmap::tm_shape(siteBoundaries) +   tmap::tm_fill(col="blue", alpha = 0.5) +   tmap::tm_borders(col = "blue")

code: tDataset <- ReLTER::get_dataset_info(datasetid = "https://deims.org/dataset/38d604ef-decb-4d67-8ac3-cc843d10d3ef") print(tDataset) #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 33 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 11.88721 ymin: 43.20518 xmax: 15.86426 ymax: 45.91294 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 34 #>   title    abstract keywords uri   type  dateRange.from dateRange.to relatedSite #> * <chr>    <chr>    <list>   <chr> <chr> <chr>          <lgl>        <list>      #> 1 LTER No‚Ä¶ The pre‚Ä¶ <df>     http‚Ä¶ data‚Ä¶ 1965-01-01     NA           <df>        #> # ‚Ä¶ with 26 more variables: contacts.corresponding <list>, #> #   contacts.creator <list>, contacts.metadataProvider <lgl>, #> #   observationParameters <list>, observationSpecies <list>, dataPolicy <list>, #> #   doi <chr>, onlineLocation <list>, legal.accessUse <list>, #> #   legal.rights <lgl>, legal.legalAct <lgl>, legal.citation <lgl>, #> #   method.instrumentation <lgl>, method.qualityAssurance <lgl>, #> #   method.methodUrl <list>, method.methodDescription <list>, ‚Ä¶  tmap::tmap_mode("plot") r <- tmaptools::read_osm(tDataset) tmap::tm_shape(r) +   tmap::tm_rgb() +   tmap::tm_shape(tDataset) +   tmap::tm_fill(col="blue", alpha = 0.5) +   tmap::tm_borders(col = "blue")

title: An Interface for the eLTER Community
text: get_site_ODS function retrieves datasets OpenDataScience, crops boundary specified eLTER site.
code: siteNDVI <- ReLTER::get_site_ODS(    deimsid = "https://deims.org/d0a8da18-0881-4ebe-bccf-bc4cb4e25701",    dataset = "ndvi_summer" ) siteBoundary <- ReLTER::get_site_info(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/d0a8da18-0881-4ebe-bccf-bc4cb4e25701",   category = "Boundaries" )  tmap::tmap_mode("plot") pal <- RColorBrewer::brewer.pal("RdYlGn", n = 5) r <- tmaptools::read_osm(siteBoundary) tmap::tm_shape(r) +   tmap::tm_rgb() +   tmap::tm_shape(siteNDVI, raster.downsample = TRUE) +   tmap::tm_raster(palette = pal, alpha = 0.7) +    tmap::tm_shape(siteBoundary) +   tmap::tm_borders("black")

code: if (FALSE) { # list of the all sites info with ILTER listOfAllSites <- get_ilter_generalinfo() length(listOfAllSites[,1])  # example about country name parameter sitesAustria <- get_ilter_generalinfo(country_name = "Austri") # (matches Austria, but not Australia) length(sitesAustria$title)  # example of single site in a country eisenwurzen <- get_ilter_generalinfo(   country_name = "Austri",   site_name = "Eisen" ) eisenwurzen[,1:2] # extract DEIMS.Id eisenwurzen_deimsid <- eisenwurzen$uri eisenwurzen_deimsid  # example of single site in a country and return only map get_ilter_generalinfo(   country_name = "Italy",   site_name = "Maggiore",   show_map = TRUE ) }

title:
Acquire various raster layers from
ODS Europe
and crops to an eLTER site boundary. ‚Äî get_site_ODS
text: function returns SpatRaster object (`terra` package) requested dataset, cropped site boundaries user save raster disk, necessary. .e. writeRaster(ds_site, "site_dataset.tif")

title:
Acquire various raster layers from
ODS Europe
and crops to an eLTER site boundary. ‚Äî get_site_ODS
text: Supported datasets ODS repository include: Landcover: Land-cover class according highest probability,    generated spatiotemporal ensemble-ML model. 30 m. resolution CLC2018: Corine land cover rasterized 100m spatial resolution    provided Copernicus Land Monitoring Service. OSM buildings: Buildings according OSM polygons    Copernicus impervious build-layer (2018),    aggregated rasterized first 10m spatial resolution    downsampled 30m spatial average. Natura2000: Protected areas rasterized NATURA 2000    (, B C site categories)    OSM (IUCN Ia, IUCN Ib, IUCN 2, IUCN 3, IUCN 4, IUCN 5, IUCN 6    others categories),    first 10m spatial resolution downsampled    30m spatial average.    overlap areas indicated new category. NDVI:  NDVI time-series,    derived Landsat quarterly temporal composites datasets georeferenced EPSG:3035 coordinate reference system. except clc2018 30 meters resolution

Acquire various raster layers from

title: Provide a map object of a sites LTER. ‚Äî produce_site_map
text: deimsid `character`. DEIMS ID network DEIMS-SDR website. DEIMS ID information . countryCode `character` following 3166-1 alpha-3 codes. ISO convention consists three-letter country codes defined ISO 3166-1, part ISO 3166 standard published International Organization Standardization (ISO), represent countries, dependent territories, special areas geographical interest. map produced function limited country indicated parameter; network extraterritorial sites represented. listOfSites `sf`. List sites specific network. list needed showing another points map. gridNx `double`. numeric vector unit object specifying x-location viewports country provided countryCode parameter. gridNy `double`. numeric vector unit object specifying y-location viewports country provided countryCode parameter. width `double`. numeric vector unit object specifying width viewports country provided countryCode parameter. Default 0.25. height `double`. numeric vector unit object specifying height viewports country provided countryCode parameter. Default 0.25. bboxXMin `double`. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. bboxXMax `double`. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. bboxYMin `double`. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. bboxYMax `double`. numeric add unit bbox provided centroid site. Default 0. show_map `boolean`. TRUE immage map plotted. Default FALSE.

title: Provide a map object of a sites LTER. ‚Äî produce_site_map
code: if (FALSE) { # Example of Lange Bramke site sitesNetwork <- get_network_sites(   networkDEIMSID =   "https://deims.org/networks/e904354a-f3a0-40ce-a9b5-61741f66c824" ) map <- produce_site_map(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/8e24d4f8-d6f6-4463-83e9-73cac2fd3f38",   countryCode = "DEU",   listOfSites = sitesNetwork,   gridNx = 0.2,   gridNy = 0.7 )  # Example of Eisenwurzen site sitesNetwork <- get_network_sites(   networkDEIMSID =   "https://deims.org/networks/d45c2690-dbef-4dbc-a742-26ea846edf28" ) map <- produce_site_map(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/d0a8da18-0881-4ebe-bccf-bc4cb4e25701",   countryCode = "AUT",   listOfSites = sitesNetwork,   gridNx = 0.2,   gridNy = 0.7 )  # Example of Lake Maggiore site sitesNetwork <- get_network_sites(   networkDEIMSID =   "https://deims.org/network/7fef6b73-e5cb-4cd2-b438-ed32eb1504b3" ) # In the case of Italian sites are selected only true sites and excluded the # macrosites. sitesNetwork <- (sitesNetwork[!grepl('^IT', sitesNetwork$title),]) sf::st_crs(sitesNetwork) = 4326 siteMap <- produce_site_map(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   countryCode = "ITA",   listOfSites = sitesNetwork,   gridNx = 0.7,   gridNy = 0.35,   show_map = TRUE ) siteMap  # with show_map = FALSE siteMap <- produce_site_map(   deimsid = "https://deims.org/f30007c4-8a6e-4f11-ab87-569db54638fe",   countryCode = "ITA",   listOfSites = sitesNetwork,   gridNx = 0.7,   gridNy = 0.35 ) siteMap }

Taxon ID provided function currently taken Pan-European Species directories Infrastructure - PESI. function takes advantage taxize's `eubon_search` function https://docs.ropensci.org/taxize/ PESI RestAPI.

title:

taxon list. ‚Äî taxon_id_pesi
text: output function `tibble` containing columns provided input new columns : 'canonicalName', 'authorship', 'synonyms', 'LSID', 'url', 'accordingTo', 'checkStatus' gathered PESI. example export dataset obtained function : datasetMerged <- dplyr::bind_rows(table) write.csv(   datasetMerged,   "table.csv",   row.names = FALSE,   fileEncoding = "UTF-8" ) Someone problems characters encoding CSV file written. resolve suggest two different solutions: Solution 1 - 1. Open CSV Notepad. 2. Click ‚ÄúFile‚Äù ‚ÄúSave ‚Äù. 3. new popup displays,  select ‚ÄúANSI‚Äù ‚ÄúEncoding‚Äù    field. 4. Click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù. 5. Now, able open file Excel display    characters correctly. Solution 2 - 1. Open Excel 2. Click ‚ÄúFile‚Äù ‚ÄúNew‚Äù 3. Click ‚ÄúData‚Äù tab 4. Click ‚ÄúText‚Äù select CSV file 5. Select ‚ÄúDelimited‚Äù 6. ‚ÄúFile origin‚Äù, select ‚Äú65001 : Unicode (UTF-8)‚Äù 7. Click ‚ÄúNext‚Äù 8. Select ‚ÄúComma‚Äù 9. Click ‚ÄúFinish‚Äù 10. Excel now show CSV file display characters     correctly.
